intro: Achimenes brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved bellflower, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with dark green, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
